result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Allen Franklin Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Allen Franklin Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth Allen Franklin Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Kenneth Allen Franklin Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 3: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 140 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment, CONCURRENT to COUNT 2. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 140 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment, CONCURRENT to COUNT 1. 
Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

- Serve 60 days condition time with Huber for work and treatment STAYED for use at the Agent's discretion.
-  Mental Health Assessment & any recommended treatment if requested by the Agent
- Random UA's.
- No contact with KHW and MMR
- Take prescription medication as prescribed
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- Restitution hearing scheduled.
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Restitution Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.

Defendant Kenneth Allen Franklin Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Kenneth Allen Franklin Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests resolution date.
Case adjourned to Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Case heard off the record due to court reporter availability. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Mary M.R.; Kermit H.W.; Jonathan A.F.  
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Kenneth Allen Franklin in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Kenneth Allen Franklin in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth Allen Franklin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  AS TO COUNT 2 "DOMESTIC ABUSE" enhancer:  Motion to dismiss by the defense for lack of probable cause, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
